author: TeraMedia
title: Clever mechanisms + sturdy design = fun to play
review:
This set had two models that were fun to play with, was just the right difficulty level for a first-time Expert Builder, and was even easy to motorize.

Box/Instructions

The instructions for both of the main models (the second is a high-wing airplane) were easy to follow.  The box was the classic plastic-lined box with bins and a fitted cover.

Parts

As an early expert-builder set, this set had parts that were hard to get elsewhere (at the time).  It was an unfortunate yellow, but I daresay that the color made the instructions easier to read, at least.

The build

No big problems during the build.

The completed model

The way the control stick manipulates the angle-of-attack of the rotor blades while still allowing for rotation is very clever and insipiring.  And fitting both the drive system and control system into such a tight space using these simple parts is pretty amazing.  Add to that the ability to motorize the rotor and tail prop with one of the 4.5v motors and this was a very entertaining set to build and play with.  Unlike the Auto Chassis' girders-and-gears appearance, this also looks somewhat like the vehicle it is intended to model.

Overall opinion

This was a fun set back in the day.  A modern technic remake would not achieve a whole lot of improvement beyond appearance, IMO.
